title: Young Jewish extremists dream of colonizing Gaza
summary: On Thursday, April 25, a small group of settlers and ultra-Orthodox attempted to infiltrate Palestinian territory. The police had no difficulty intercepting the group with messianic and farcical overtones.

title: Sciences Po announces closure of main Paris site over Gaza protest
summary: A series of protests have erupted at the prestigious French university, fueled by anger over the Israel-Hamas war and the resulting humanitarian crisis in the besieged Palestinian territory of Gaza.

title: Iran's morality police make a comeback
summary: The authorities have launched a new operation dubbed the 'Light Plan' against women who refuse to wear the hijab, a freedom snatched away following the death in custody of Mahsa Amini in September 2022.

title: US Republicans are exploiting pro-Palestinian protests on campuses
summary: Under the pretext of denouncing anti-Semitism, the Grand Old Party's politicians are reverting to the familiar strains of the culture war to oppose Democrats.

title: Turkey announces suspension of all trade with Israel
summary: Turkey's trade ministry on Thursday announced that it will halt all trade 'until the Israeli government authorizes an uninterrupted flow of humanitarian aid to Gaza.'

title: Kids and screentime: What the committee appointed by Macron recommends
summary: Their report advises against exposing under-threes to screens and suggests waiting until the age of 11 for a cellphone and 13 for a smartphone with internet access.

title: Macron doesn't rule out troops for Ukraine if Russia breaks front lines
summary: Speaking to The Economist, the French president said it's necessary to have a 'strategic ambiguity' when dealing with Vladimir Putin.

title: China fears climate change impacts after highway collapses due to torrential rains
summary: Forty-eight people died in Guangdong province after a landslide swept away a section of freeway. Officials say the particularly intense rainfall is linked to climate change.

title: Biden says 'dissent must never lead to disorder' amid pro-Palestinian protests on US campuses
summary: Speaking from the White House on Thursday, the US president defended the right to protest but said 'order must prevail,' over heated clashes at US universities protesting the war in Gaza.

title: Europa League: Marseille and Atalanta draw in semi-final first leg
summary: After a 1-1 tie at home, Marseille will have to beat Atalanta in Italy next Thursday if it hopes to reach the Europa League final.

title: UN calls on Georgia to withdraw divisive 'foreign agent' bill
summary: Tens of thousands of people turned out to protest again on Thursday against this bill likened to Russian laws silencing dissent.

title: Arizona governor signs bill overturning 1864 abortion ban
summary: Democratic Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs on Thursday signed a bill repealing a Civil War-era ban on most abortions.

title: Carla Bruni-Sarkozy questioned in husband's witness tampering case
summary: The wife of former French president Nicolas Sarkozy is being investigated for her ties to a former 'paparazzi queen' suspected of orchestrating the retraction of a key witness in the case on Sarkozy's suspected Libyan campaign financing.

title: PSG defender Hernandez needs surgery, likely to miss Euro 2024
summary: Lucas Hernandez ruptured his left knee ACL during the first leg of the Champions League semi-final against Borussia Dortmund on Wednesday.

title: Paris garbage collectors threaten Olympics strike
summary: The union representing the trash collectors warned the strike could start in May and go on throughout the Olympic Games, which take place in the capital from July 26 to August 11.

title: The war in Gaza is sending American campuses into turmoil
summary: On Tuesday, police evacuated an encampment of pro-Palestinian students at Columbia, the epicenter of a movement demanding that higher education institutions renounce their investments in companies closely or remotely linked to the war in Gaza.

title: Georgians face repression after anti-Western rhetoric from authorities
summary: The police intervened violently on Tuesday and Wednesday against demonstrators opposed to the draft law on 'foreign influence,' in the wake of a threatening speech by the country's master, oligarch Bidzina Ivanishvili.

title: Macron to make rare state visit to Germany from May 26
summary: The French president will join commemoration ceremonies marking the foundation of post-war West Germany and the end of Communist rule in East Germany.

title: Chanel takes a breather in Marseille
summary: The luxury fashion house opted for the southern French city's Cité Radieuse's rooftop to present its cruise show on Thursday, May 2. Embroidered little fish and shell pendants adorned a comfortable collection staying true to Chanel's legacy.

title: Brazil: Torrential rains kill at least 29 people, 60 missing
summary: Governor Eduardo Leite said Brazil's southernmost state, Rio Grande do Sul, was dealing with 'the worst disaster in [its] history.'

title: US judge declares mistrial in Abu Ghraib torture case against military contractor
summary: The plaintiffs accused civilian interrogators, provided to the US Army at Abu Ghraib Prison in Iraq during 2003 and 2004, of conspiring with soldiers to abuse detainees.

title: Isild Le Besco, survivor of violence: 'Prisoner of my material and emotional shortcomings, I was the perfect target for all abuse'
summary: The actress and filmmaker reveals her intimate wounds and the mechanisms of predation in an autobiographical account, 'Dire vrai' ('Telling true').

title: The Channel Islands dream of a tunnel linking them to France
summary: Economic and political leaders in the Channel Islands are seriously considering building a tunnel to connect Jersey and Guernsey with the French coast. Locally, the not-so-new idea is no longer met with mockery.

title: UNESCO study says 70% of environmental journalists report attacks, threat, pressure
summary: UNESCO said at least 749 journalists and news media outlets reporting on environmental issues were 'targeted with murder, physical violence, detention and arrest, online harassment or legal attacks' between 2009 and 2023.

title: Uber Narcos
summary: Customer service, franchises, discounts – using the same model as food deliveries, home drug delivery has rapidly developed in France.

title: Moulin Rouge loses blades, not glory
summary: The cabaret's red blades fell onto the Pigalle sidewalk on April 25. But this landmark of Parisian nightlife has witnessed plenty of drama in its 135-year history.

title: Campus debate on Gaza fails to achieve consensus at Sciences Po
summary: Six students from the Palestine Committee started a hunger strike and the administration announced the closure of its main Paris branch on Friday.

title: Drugs in Paris: The leak that implicated a police chief
summary: Overdose. France under the influence | Part 4. Le Monde learned that a highly experienced chief brigadier, who for a long time was in charge of narcotics in the Paris suburbs, is suspected of having colluded with major drug traffickers.

title: Kenya hit by 'one of the most violent' El Niño episodes since 1950
summary: At least 29 of the country's 47 counties are affected by heavy rains. Kenya's death toll from flooding has risen to at least 188 since March.

title: The false and obscene Spanish story of the Ravensbrück brothel
summary: In a bestseller she claims is based on historical fact, writer Fermina Cañaveras depicts a Spanish deportee who was supposedly forced into prostitution. This is just one of the many 'errors' scattered throughout the controversial story.

title: Noose is tightening around Ukrainian exiles of fighting age
summary: Kyiv has ordered the temporary suspension of all consular activities for men aged between 18 and 60. In Berlin, Paris and Warsaw, there is both concern and anger.

title: European elections: Macron pick Hayer fails to unnerve far-right Bardella in debate
summary: The ruling coalition's figurehead for the European elections failed to destabilize her far-right counterpart who lambasted President Emmanuel Macron's record during an encounter that often dwelt on non-European topics.

title: Alcaraz withdraws from Italian Open with continuing forearm pain
summary: The world's number three tennis player Carlos Alcaraz ended his 14-match winning streak with a loss to Andrey Rublev in Madrid on Wednesday.

title: Paris 2024: High-end offers struggle to win over VIP clientele
summary: On Location, the exclusive hospitality provider for the Paris Olympic and Paralympic Games, admits that it has to adapt to last-minute purchases for services that can cost tens of thousands of euros.

title: Why French music exports are still going strong
summary: The phenomenon of synchronization and the popularity of music sung in French explain the success of French musical productions abroad, according to a study.

title: The gradual erosion of British trade since Brexit
summary: The UK's trade in goods has fallen by 10% since 2019, while that of the other G7 countries has risen by 5%.

title: How Macron wants to 'Europeanize' nuclear deterrence
summary: The French president is looking to extend France's nuclear deterrent capability in light of Donald Tump's possible return to the White House and the ongoing war in Ukraine, experts say.

title: 'Xi Jinping has much more in common with Stalin than Mao'
summary: With the Chinese leader making a state visit to France on May 6 and 7, China expert Jean-Philippe Béja explains how Xi strengthened his control of the state apparatus using bureaucracy, party institutions and increased surveillance of the population.

title: Janette Beckman, counter-culture portraitist: 'I photographed Ice Cube at his mother's house'
summary: She became a photographer almost by chance in the late 1970s, immortalizing the rising stars of the punk, rock and hip-hop scenes. Bearing witness to a bygone era, her photos are on show from May 10 at Amsterdam's Museum of Photography.

title: Tense working climate, suspicions of tax evasion: Disney France caught in a storm
summary: A new redundancy plan at Disney France, a subsidiary of the entertainment giant, is causing confusion and unease among employees.

title: German foreign minister summons Russia over 2023 cyber-attacks
summary: Annalena Baerbock said on Friday that Russian state hackers were behind the hacking of emails of the Social Democrats, the leading party in the governing coalition.

title: Discovering Vienna in Freud's footsteps
summary: The famous neurologist and founder of psychoanalysis lived in the Austrian capital for half a century.

title: Xi Jinping in Paris: 'It's a slap from Macron,' say France's Uyghurs
summary: While several Western countries, including the United States, France and the United Kingdom, have denounced an ongoing 'genocide' against the Uyghurs, the Chinese president is due to land to make a state visit to Paris on Monday and Tuesday.

title: Solène Brun, sociologist: 'The myth of happy mixed-race completely conceals relations of power and domination'
summary: In her latest study, the sociologist shows that mixed-race is first and foremost a social experience and analyzes how race is constructed within mixed-race families.

title: Canada: Three arrested over killing of Sikh activist
summary: Canadian broadcaster CBC said Friday, May 3, that the suspects are facing first-degree murder and conspiracy charges.

title: Former Trump adviser recounts fear over 'Access Hollywood' tape during campaign
summary: Hope Hicks was a key player in the final stages of Trump's successful 2016 presidential campaign when hush money payments to porn star Stormy Daniels were allegedly made.

title: France condemns deadly attack on Red Cross convoy in Sudan
summary: The ICRC said gunmen killed two drivers and injured three staff in South Darfur last Thursday as they returned from a humanitarian mission.
